title: Saltburn Gill Walk Route

images.title: Mick Garratt / Saltburn Gill
images.caption: In May 1999, the water in Saltburn Gill turned orange due to rising water levels in the disused Longacres Ironstone Mine in Skelton-in-Cleveland. A remediation programme implemented over the following years restored water quality, leading to the return of fish to the gill by 2016.

images.title: Footbridge over Saltburn Gill by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footbridge over Saltburn Gill

images.title: Public footpath to Saltburn Gill Nature Reserve by Christine Johnstone, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Public footpath to Saltburn Gill Nature Reserve

images.title: Saltburn Gill by Keith Evans, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

description: This walk takes you along the Saltburn Gill in Saltburn, Redcar and Cleveland. The walk starts off from the car park in Old Saltburn, close to the start of the gill. Here you can pick up a footpath heading south east along the water. Along the way there's peaceful woodland and countryside views to enjoy. The site is designated as a nature reserve so look out for lots of interesting flora and fauna. The walk finishes just to the east of Brotton. You can continue your walking in the area at the lovely Saltburn Valley Gardens .
display_address: Saltburn Road, Old Saltburn, Saltburn, Marske and New Marske, Saltburn by the Sea, Redcar and Cleveland, Tees Valley, England, TS12 1NY, United Kingdom
